snippet: Conquering the town in the embattled province of Anbar would connect two jihadist strongholds.
abstract: Islamic State militant group has been on offensive throughout Anbar Province, Iraq, and are mustering tanks, armored vehicles and heavy weapons near strategically located rural town about 25 miles west of Baghdad; controlling the area would give fighters a strategic advantage over an important transportation corridor.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and ALI HAMZA

lead_paragraph: Conquering the town in the embattled province of Anbar would connect two jihadist strongholds.

headline.main: Siege Possible as ISIS Nears Strategic Town in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Siege Possible as ISIS Nears Strategic Town

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
